parameters.shortDesc: Trim value for main output channel 8
parameters.longDesc: Set to normalized offset

parameters.name: PWM_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Set the maximum PWM for the main outputs
parameters.longDesc: Set to 2000 for industry default or 2100 to increase servo travel.

parameters.name: PWM_MIN
parameters.shortDesc: Set the minimum PWM for the main outputs
parameters.longDesc: Set to 1000 for industry default or 900 to increase servo travel.

parameters.name: PWM_RATE
parameters.shortDesc: Set the PWM output frequency for the main outputs
parameters.longDesc: Set to 400 for industry default or 1000 for high frequency ESCs. Set to 0 for Oneshot125.

parameters.name: PWM_SBUS_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Set to 1 to enable S.BUS version 1 output instead of RSSI.

parameters.name: RBCLW_ADDRESS
parameters.longDesc: The Roboclaw can be configured to have an address from 0x80 to 0x87, inclusive. It must be configured to match this parameter.

parameters.name: RBCLW_BAUD
parameters.longDesc: Baud rate of the serial communication with the Roboclaw. The Roboclaw must be configured to match this rate.

parameters.name: RBCLW_COUNTS_REV
parameters.longDesc: Number of encoder counts for one revolution. The roboclaw treats analog encoders (potentiometers) as having 2047 counts per rev. The default value of 1200 corresponds to the default configuration of the Aion R1 rover.

parameters.name: RBCLW_READ_PER
parameters.longDesc: How long to wait, in Milliseconds, between reading wheel encoder values over Uart from the Roboclaw

parameters.name: RBCLW_SER_CFG
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run Roboclaw Driver.

parameters.name: RBCLW_WRITE_PER
parameters.longDesc: How long to wait, in Milliseconds, between writing actuator controls over Uart to the Roboclaw

parameters.name: RC/(\d+)/_DZ
parameters.longDesc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.

parameters.name: RC/(\d+)/_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum value for this channel.

parameters.name: RC/(\d+)/_MIN
parameters.longDesc: Minimum value for this channel.

parameters.name: RC/(\d+)/_REV
parameters.longDesc: Set to -1 to reverse channel.

parameters.name: RC/(\d+)/_TRIM
parameters.longDesc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).

parameters.name: RC_ACRO_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_ARMSWITCH_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_ASSIST_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_AUTO_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_CHAN_CNT
parameters.longDesc: This parameter is used by Ground Station software to save the number of channels which were used during RC calibration. It is only meant for ground station use.

parameters.name: RC_FAILS_THR
parameters.longDesc: Set to a value slightly above the PWM value assumed by throttle in a failsafe event, but ensure it is below the PWM value assumed by throttle during normal operation.

parameters.name: RC_GEAR_TH
parameters.shortDesc: Threshold for the landing gear switch
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_KILLSWITCH_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_LOITER_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_MAN_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_MAP_ARM_SW
parameters.longDesc: Use it to arm/disarm via switch instead of default throttle stick. If this is assigned, arming and disarming via stick is disabled.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_AUX1
parameters.longDesc: Default function: Camera pitch

parameters.name: RC_MAP_AUX2
parameters.longDesc: Default function: Camera roll

parameters.name: RC_MAP_AUX3
parameters.longDesc: Default function: Camera azimuth / yaw

parameters.name: RC_MAP_FAILSAFE
parameters.longDesc: The RC mapping index indicates which channel is used for failsafe If 0, whichever channel is mapped to throttle is used otherwise the value indicates the specific RC channel to use

parameters.name: RC_MAP_FLTMODE
parameters.longDesc: If this parameter is non-zero, flight modes are only selected by this channel and are assigned to six slots.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_MODE_SW
parameters.longDesc: This is the main flight mode selector. The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for deciding about the main mode. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_PARAM1
parameters.longDesc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 1st parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameters.name: RC_MAP_PARAM2
parameters.longDesc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 2nd parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameters.name: RC_MAP_PARAM3
parameters.longDesc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 3th parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameters.name: RC_MAP_PITCH
parameters.longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading pitch inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_ROLL
parameters.longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading roll inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_THROTTLE
parameters.longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading throttle inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_YAW
parameters.longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading yaw inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: RC_OFFB_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_PORT_CONFIG
parameters.shortDesc: Serial Configuration for RC Input Driver
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run RC Input Driver. Setting this to 'Disabled' will use a board-specific default port for RC input.

parameters.name: RC_POSCTL_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_RATT_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_RETURN_TH
parameters.shortDesc: Threshold for selecting return to launch mode
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_RSSI_PWM_CHAN
parameters.shortDesc: PWM input channel that provides RSSI
parameters.longDesc: 0: do not read RSSI from input channel 1-18: read RSSI from specified input channel Specify the range for RSSI input with RC_RSSI_PWM_MIN and RC_RSSI_PWM_MAX parameters.

parameters.name: RC_RSSI_PWM_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Max input value for RSSI reading
parameters.longDesc: Only used if RC_RSSI_PWM_CHAN > 0

parameters.name: RC_RSSI_PWM_MIN
parameters.shortDesc: Min input value for RSSI reading
parameters.longDesc: Only used if RC_RSSI_PWM_CHAN > 0

parameters.name: RC_STAB_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_TRANS_TH
parameters.shortDesc: Threshold for the VTOL transition switch
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RTL_CONE_ANG
parameters.shortDesc: Half-angle of the return mode altitude cone
parameters.longDesc: Defines the half-angle of a cone centered around the destination position that affects the altitude at which the vehicle returns.

values.description: No cone, always climb to RTL_RETURN_ALT above destination.
Only climb to at least RTL_DESCEND_ALT above destination.

parameters.name: RTL_DESCEND_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Descend to this altitude (above destination position) after return, and wait for time defined in RTL_LAND_DELAY. Land (i.e. slowly descend) from this altitude if autolanding allowed.

parameters.name: RTL_LAND_DELAY
parameters.longDesc: Delay before landing (after initial descent) in Return mode. If set to -1 the system will not land but loiter at RTL_DESCEND_ALT.

parameters.name: RTL_MIN_DIST
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum horizontal distance from return destination, below which RTL_DESCEND_ALT is used as return altitude
parameters.longDesc: If the vehicle is less than this horizontal distance from the return destination when return mode is activated it will ascend to RTL_DESCEND_ALT for the return journey (rather than the altitude set by RTL_RETURN_ALT and RTL_CONE_ANG).

parameters.name: RTL_PLD_MD
parameters.longDesc: Use precision landing when doing an RTL landing phase.

parameters.name: RTL_RETURN_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Default minimum altitude above destination (e.g. home, safe point, landing pattern) for return flight. This is affected by RTL_MIN_DIST and RTL_CONE_ANG.

parameters.name: RTL_TYPE
parameters.longDesc: Return mode destination and flight path (home location, rally point, mission landing pattern, reverse mission)

values.description: Return to closest safe point (home or rally point) via direct path.
Return to closest safe point other than home (mission landing pattern or rally point), via direct path. If no mission landing or rally points are defined return home via direct path.
Return to a planned mission landing, if available, using the mission path, else return to home via the reverse mission path. Do not consider rally points.
Return via direct path to closest destination: home, start of mission landing pattern or safe point. If the destination is a mission landing pattern, follow the pattern to land.

parameters.name: RTPS_CONFIG
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run FastRTPS.

parameters.name: RTPS_MAV_CONFIG
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run MAVLink + FastRTPS.

parameters.name: RWTO_AIRSPD_SCL
parameters.shortDesc: Min. airspeed scaling factor for takeoff. Pitch up will be commanded when the following airspeed is reached: FW_AIRSPD_MIN * RWTO_AIRSPD_SCL

parameters.name: RWTO_HDG
parameters.shortDesc: Specifies which heading should be held during runnway takeoff
parameters.longDesc: 0: airframe heading, 1: heading towards takeoff waypoint

parameters.name: RWTO_MAX_PITCH
parameters.shortDesc: Max pitch during takeoff. Fixed-wing settings are used if set to 0. Note that there is also a minimum pitch of 10 degrees during takeoff, so this must be larger if set

parameters.name: RWTO_MAX_ROLL
parameters.shortDesc: Max roll during climbout. Roll is limited during climbout to ensure enough lift and prevents aggressive navigation before we're on a safe height

parameters.name: RWTO_MAX_THR
parameters.shortDesc: Max throttle during runway takeoff. (Can be used to test taxi on runway)

parameters.name: RWTO_NAV_ALT
parameters.shortDesc: Altitude AGL at which we have enough ground clearance to allow some roll. Until RWTO_NAV_ALT is reached the plane is held level and only rudder is used to keep the heading (see RWTO_HDG). This should be below FW_CLMBOUT_DIFF if FW_CLMBOUT_DIFF > 0

parameters.name: RWTO_PSP
parameters.shortDesc: Pitch setpoint during taxi / before takeoff airspeed is reached. A taildragger with stearable wheel might need to pitch up a little to keep it's wheel on the ground before airspeed to takeoff is reached

parameters.name: RWTO_RAMP_TIME
parameters.shortDesc: Throttle ramp up time for runway takeoff

parameters.name: SDLOG_BOOT_BAT
parameters.longDesc: When enabled, logging will not start from boot if battery power is not detected (e.g. powered via USB on a test bench). This prevents extraneous flight logs from being created during bench testing. Note that this only applies to log-from-boot modes. This has no effect on arm-based modes.

parameters.name: SDLOG_DIRS_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum number of log directories to keep
parameters.longDesc: If there are more log directories than this value, the system will delete the oldest directories during startup. In addition, the system will delete old logs if there is not enough free space left. The minimum amount is 300 MB. If this is set to 0, old directories will only be removed if the free space falls below the minimum. Note: this does not apply to mission log files.

parameters.name: SDLOG_MISSION
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, a small additional "mission" log file will be written to the SD card. The log contains just those messages that are useful for tasks like generating flight statistics and geotagging. The different modes can be used to further reduce the logged data (and thus the log file size). For example, choose geotagging mode to only log data required for geotagging. Note that the normal/full log is still created, and contains all the data in the mission log (and more).

parameters.name: SDLOG_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Determines when to start and stop logging. By default, logging is started when arming the system, and stopped when disarming.

parameters.name: SDLOG_PROFILE
parameters.longDesc: This integer bitmask controls the set and rates of logged topics. The default allows for general log analysis and estimator replay, while keeping the log file size reasonably small. Enabling multiple sets leads to higher bandwidth requirements and larger log files. Set bits true to enable: 0 : Default set (used for general log analysis) 1 : Full rate estimator (EKF2) replay topics 2 : Topics for thermal calibration (high rate raw IMU and Baro sensor data) 3 : Topics for system identification (high rate actuator control and IMU data) 4 : Full rates for analysis of fast maneuvers (RC, attitude, rates and actuators) 5 : Debugging topics (debug_*.msg topics, for custom code) 6 : Topics for sensor comparison (low rate raw IMU, Baro and Magnetomer data) 7 : Topics for computer vision and collision avoidance 8 : Raw FIFO high-rate IMU (Gyro) 9 : Raw FIFO high-rate IMU (Accel)

parameters.name: SDLOG_UTC_OFFSET
parameters.longDesc: the difference in hours and minutes from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for a your place and date. for example, In case of South Korea(UTC+09:00), UTC offset is 540 min (9*60) refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_UTC_time_offsets

parameters.name: SDLOG_UUID
parameters.longDesc: If set to 1, add an ID to the log, which uniquely identifies the vehicle

parameters.name: SENS_BOARD_ROT
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the FMU board relative to the platform.

parameters.name: SENS_BOARD_X_OFF
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the X (Roll) axis It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameters.name: SENS_BOARD_Y_OFF
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Y (Pitch) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameters.name: SENS_BOARD_Z_OFF
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Z (Yaw) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameters.name: SENS_CM8JL65_CFG
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run Lanbao PSK-CM8JL65-CC5.

parameters.name: SENS_CM8JL65_R_0
parameters.longDesc: Distance Sensor Rotation as MAV_SENSOR_ORIENTATION enum

parameters.name: SENS_DPRES_ANSC
parameters.longDesc: Pick the appropriate scaling from the datasheet. this number defines the (linear) conversion from voltage to Pascal (pa). For the MPXV7002DP this is 1000. NOTE: If the sensor always registers zero, try switching the static and dynamic tubes.

parameters.name: SENS_DPRES_OFF
parameters.longDesc: The offset (zero-reading) in Pascal

parameters.name: SENS_EXT_I2C_PRB
parameters.longDesc: Probe for optional external I2C devices.

parameters.name: SENS_FLOW_MAXHGT
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum height above ground when reliant on optical flow
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines the maximum distance from ground at which the optical flow sensor operates reliably. The height setpoint will be limited to be no greater than this value when the navigation system is completely reliant on optical flow data and the height above ground estimate is valid. The sensor may be usable above this height, but accuracy will progressively degrade.

parameters.name: SENS_FLOW_MAXR
parameters.shortDesc: Magnitude of maximum angular flow rate reliably measurable by the optical flow sensor. Optical flow data will not fused by the estimators if the magnitude of the flow rate exceeds this value and control loops will be instructed to limit ground speed such that the flow rate produced by movement over ground is less than 50% of this value

parameters.name: SENS_FLOW_MINHGT
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum height above ground when reliant on optical flow
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines the minimum distance from ground at which the optical flow sensor operates reliably. The sensor may be usable below this height, but accuracy will progressively reduce to loss of focus.

parameters.name: SENS_FLOW_ROT
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines the yaw rotation of the PX4FLOW board relative to the vehicle body frame. Zero rotation is defined as X on flow board pointing towards front of vehicle. The recommneded installation default for the PX4FLOW board is with the Y axis forward (270 deg yaw).

parameters.name: SENS_IMU_TEMP_I
parameters.shortDesc: IMU heater controller integrator gain value

parameters.name: SENS_IMU_TEMP_P
parameters.shortDesc: IMU heater controller proportional gain value

parameters.name: SENS_LEDDAR1_CFG
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run LeddarOne Rangefinder.

parameters.name: SENS_MB12_/(\d+)/_ROT
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.

parameters.name: SENS_MPDT/(\d+)/_ROT
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameters.name: SENS_SF0X_CFG
parameters.shortDesc: Serial Configuration for Lightware Laser Rangefinder
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run Lightware Laser Rangefinder.

parameters.name: SENS_TEMP_ID
parameters.shortDesc: Target IMU device ID to regulate temperature

parameters.name: SENS_TFMINI_CFG
parameters.shortDesc: Serial Configuration for Benewake TFmini Rangefinder
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run Benewake TFmini Rangefinder.

parameters.name: SENS_ULAND_CFG
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run uLanding Radar.

parameters.name: SER_GPS/(\d+)/_BAUD
parameters.shortDesc: Baudrate for the GPS 1 Serial Port
parameters.longDesc: Configure the Baudrate for the GPS 1 Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameters.name: SER_RC_BAUD
parameters.shortDesc: Baudrate for the Radio Controller Serial Port
parameters.longDesc: Configure the Baudrate for the Radio Controller Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameters.name: SER_TEL/(\d+)/_BAUD
parameters.shortDesc: Baudrate for the TELEM 1 Serial Port
parameters.longDesc: Configure the Baudrate for the TELEM 1 Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameters.name: SER_URT6_BAUD
parameters.shortDesc: Baudrate for the UART 6 Serial Port
parameters.longDesc: Configure the Baudrate for the UART 6 Serial Port. Note: certain drivers such as the GPS can determine the Baudrate automatically.

parameters.name: SIH_IXX
parameters.longDesc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameters.name: SIH_IXY
parameters.longDesc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameters.name: SIH_IXZ
parameters.longDesc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameters.name: SIH_IYY
parameters.longDesc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameters.name: SIH_IYZ
parameters.longDesc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameters.name: SIH_IZZ
parameters.longDesc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameters.name: SIH_KDV
parameters.longDesc: Physical coefficient representing the friction with air particules. The greater this value, the slower the quad will move. Drag force function of velocity: D=-KDV*V. The maximum freefall velocity can be computed as V=10*MASS/KDV [m/s]

parameters.name: SIH_KDW
parameters.longDesc: Physical coefficient representing the friction with air particules during rotations. The greater this value, the slower the quad will rotate. Aerodynamic moment function of body rate: Ma=-KDW*W_B. This value can be set to 0 if unknown.

parameters.name: SIH_LOC_H0
parameters.longDesc: This value represents the Above Mean Sea Level (AMSL) altitude where the simulation begins. If using FlightGear as a visual animation, this value can be tweaked such that the vehicle lies on the ground at takeoff. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameters.name: SIH_LOC_LAT0
parameters.longDesc: This value represents the North-South location on Earth where the simulation begins. A value of 45 deg should be written 450000000. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameters.name: SIH_LOC_LON0
parameters.longDesc: This value represents the East-West location on Earth where the simulation begins. A value of 45 deg should be written 450000000. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameters.name: SIH_LOC_MU_X
parameters.shortDesc: North magnetic field at the initial location
parameters.longDesc: This value represents the North magnetic field at the initial location. A magnetic field calculator can be found on the NOAA website Note, the values need to be converted from nano Tesla to Gauss LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameters.name: SIH_LOC_MU_Y
parameters.shortDesc: East magnetic field at the initial location
parameters.longDesc: This value represents the East magnetic field at the initial location. A magnetic field calculator can be found on the NOAA website Note, the values need to be converted from nano Tesla to Gauss LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameters.name: SIH_LOC_MU_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Down magnetic field at the initial location
parameters.longDesc: This value represents the Down magnetic field at the initial location. A magnetic field calculator can be found on the NOAA website Note, the values need to be converted from nano Tesla to Gauss LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameters.name: SIH_L_PITCH
parameters.longDesc: This is the arm length generating the pitching moment This value can be measured with a ruler. This corresponds to half the distance between the front and rear motors.

parameters.name: SIH_L_ROLL
parameters.longDesc: This is the arm length generating the rolling moment This value can be measured with a ruler. This corresponds to half the distance between the left and right motors.

parameters.name: SIH_MASS
parameters.longDesc: This value can be measured by weighting the quad on a scale.

parameters.name: SIH_Q_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the maximum torque delivered by one propeller when the motor is running at full speed. This value is usually about few percent of the maximum thrust force.

parameters.name: SIH_T_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the maximum force delivered by one propeller when the motor is running at full speed. This value is usually about 5 times the mass of the quadrotor.

parameters.name: SIM_ACCEL_BLOCK
parameters.longDesc: Enable to block the publication of any incoming simulation accelerometer data.

parameters.name: SIM_BARO_BLOCK
parameters.longDesc: Enable to block the publication of any incoming simulation barometer data.

parameters.name: SIM_BAT_MIN_PCT
parameters.shortDesc: Simulator Battery minimal percentage. Can be used to alter the battery level during SITL- or HITL-simulation on the fly. Particularly useful for testing different low-battery behaviour

parameters.name: SIM_DPRES_BLOCK
parameters.longDesc: Enable to block the publication of any incoming simulation differential pressure data.

parameters.name: SIM_GPS_BLOCK
parameters.longDesc: Enable to block the publication of any incoming simulation GPS data.

parameters.name: SIM_GYRO_BLOCK
parameters.longDesc: Enable to block the publication of any incoming simulation gyroscope data.

parameters.name: SIM_MAG_BLOCK
parameters.longDesc: Enable to block the publication of any incoming simulation magnetometer data.

parameters.name: SYS_AUTOCONFIG
parameters.longDesc: Set to 1 to reset parameters on next system startup (setting defaults). Platform-specific values are used if available. RC* parameters are preserved.

parameters.name: SYS_AUTOSTART
parameters.longDesc: CHANGING THIS VALUE REQUIRES A RESTART. Defines the auto-start script used to bootstrap the system.

parameters.name: SYS_BL_UPDATE
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, update the bootloader on the next boot. WARNING: do not cut the power during an update process, otherwise you will have to recover using some alternative method (e.g. JTAG). Instructions: - Insert an SD card - Enable this parameter - Reboot the board (plug the power or send a reboot command) - Wait until the board comes back up (or at least 2 minutes) - If it does not come back, check the file bootlog.txt on the SD card

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_ACCEL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable auto start of accelerometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameters.longDesc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_BARO
parameters.shortDesc: Enable auto start of barometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameters.longDesc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_GYRO
parameters.shortDesc: Enable auto start of rate gyro thermal calibration at the next power up
parameters.longDesc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_TDEL
parameters.shortDesc: Required temperature rise during thermal calibration
parameters.longDesc: A temperature increase greater than this value is required during calibration. Calibration will complete for each sensor when the temperature increase above the starting temeprature exceeds the value set by SYS_CAL_TDEL. If the temperature rise is insufficient, the calibration will continue indefinitely and the board will need to be repowered to exit.

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_TMAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameters.longDesc: Temperature calibration will not start if the temperature of any sensor is higher than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMAX.

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_TMIN
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameters.longDesc: Temperature calibration for each sensor will ignore data if the temperature is lower than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMIN.

parameters.name: SYS_HAS_BARO
parameters.shortDesc: Control if the vehicle has a barometer
parameters.longDesc: Disable this if the board has no barometer, such as some of the the Omnibus F4 SD variants. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a barometer.

parameters.name: SYS_HAS_MAG
parameters.shortDesc: Control if the vehicle has a magnetometer
parameters.longDesc: Disable this if the board has no magnetometer, such as the Omnibus F4 SD. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a magnetometer.

parameters.name: SYS_HITL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable HITL/SIH mode on next boot
parameters.longDesc: While enabled the system will boot in Hardware-In-The-Loop (HITL) or Simulation-In-Hardware (SIH) mode and not enable all sensors and checks. When disabled the same vehicle can be flown normally. Set to 'external HITL', if the system should perform as if it were a real vehicle (the only difference to a real system is then only the parameter value, which can be used for log analysis).

parameters.name: SYS_MC_EST_GROUP
parameters.longDesc: Set the group of estimators used for multicopters and VTOLs

parameters.name: SYS_PARAM_VER
parameters.longDesc: This is used internally only: an airframe configuration might set an expected parameter version value via PARAM_DEFAULTS_VER. This is checked on bootup against SYS_PARAM_VER, and if they do not match, parameters from the airframe configuration are reloaded.

parameters.name: SYS_RESTART_TYPE
parameters.longDesc: Set by px4io to indicate type of restart

parameters.name: SYS_USE_IO
parameters.longDesc: Can be used to use a standard startup script but with a FMU only set-up. Set to 0 to force the FMU only set-up.

parameters.name: TC_G_ENABLE
parameters.shortDesc: Thermal compensation for rate gyro sensors

parameters.name: TEL_BST_EN
parameters.longDesc: If true, the FMU will try to connect to Blacksheep telemetry on start up

parameters.name: TEL_FRSKY_CONFIG
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run FrSky Telemetry.

parameters.name: TEL_HOTT_CONFIG
parameters.longDesc: Configure on which serial port to run HoTT Telemetry.

parameters.name: THR_MDL_FAC
parameters.shortDesc: Thrust to motor control signal model parameter
parameters.longDesc: Parameter used to model the nonlinear relationship between motor control signal (e.g. PWM) and static thrust. The model is: rel_thrust = factor * rel_signal^2 + (1-factor) * rel_signal, where rel_thrust is the normalized thrust between 0 and 1, and rel_signal is the relative motor control signal between 0 and 1.

parameters.name: TRIG_ACT_TIME
parameters.longDesc: This parameter sets the time the trigger needs to pulled high or low.

parameters.name: TRIG_DISTANCE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the distance at which to trigger the camera.

parameters.name: TRIG_INTERFACE
parameters.longDesc: Selects the trigger interface

parameters.name: TRIG_INTERVAL
parameters.longDesc: This parameter sets the time between two consecutive trigger events

parameters.name: TRIG_MIN_INTERVA
parameters.longDesc: This parameter sets the minimum time between two consecutive trigger events the specific camera setup is supporting.

parameters.name: TRIG_PINS
parameters.longDesc: Selects which FMU pin is used (range: AUX1-AUX6 on Pixhawk controllers with an I/O board, MAIN1-MAIN6 on controllers without an I/O board. The PWM interface takes two pins per camera, while relay triggers on every pin individually. Example: Value 56 would trigger on pins 5 and 6. For GPIO mode Pin 6 will be triggered followed by 5. With a value of 65 pin 5 will be triggered followed by 6. Pins may be non contiguous. I.E. 16 or 61. In GPIO mode the delay pin to pin is < .2 uS.

parameters.name: TRIG_POLARITY
parameters.longDesc: This parameter sets the polarity of the trigger (0 = active low, 1 = active high )

parameters.name: TRIG_PWM_NEUTRAL
parameters.shortDesc: PWM neutral output on trigger pin

parameters.name: TRIM_PITCH
parameters.longDesc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.

parameters.name: TRIM_ROLL
parameters.longDesc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.

parameters.name: TRIM_YAW
parameters.longDesc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.

parameters.name: UAVCAN_ENABLE
parameters.longDesc: 0 - UAVCAN disabled. 1 - Enables support for UAVCAN sensors without dynamic node ID allocation and firmware update. 2 - Enables support for UAVCAN sensors with dynamic node ID allocation and firmware update. 3 - Enables support for UAVCAN sensors and actuators with dynamic node ID allocation and firmware update. Also sets the motor control outputs to UAVCAN.

parameters.name: UAVCAN_ESC_IDLT
parameters.shortDesc: UAVCAN ESC will spin at idle throttle when armed, even if the mixer outputs zero setpoints

parameters.name: UAVCAN_NODE_ID
parameters.longDesc: Read the specs at http://uavcan.org to learn more about Node ID.

parameters.name: VT_ARSP_BLEND
parameters.longDesc: Airspeed at which we can start blending both fw and mc controls. Set to 0 to disable.

parameters.name: VT_ARSP_TRANS
parameters.longDesc: Airspeed at which we can switch to fw mode

parameters.name: VT_B_DEC_FF
parameters.shortDesc: Backtransition deceleration setpoint to pitch feedforward gain

parameters.name: VT_B_DEC_I
parameters.shortDesc: Backtransition deceleration setpoint to pitch I gain

parameters.name: VT_B_DEC_MSS
parameters.longDesc: The approximate deceleration during a back transition in m/s/s Used to calculate back transition distance in mission mode. A lower value will make the VTOL transition further from the destination waypoint. For standard vtol and tiltrotors a controller is used to track this value during the transition.

parameters.name: VT_B_REV_DEL
parameters.shortDesc: Delay in seconds before applying back transition throttle Set this to a value greater than 0 to give the motor time to spin down
parameters.longDesc: unit s

parameters.name: VT_B_REV_OUT
parameters.shortDesc: Output on airbrakes channel during back transition Used for airbrakes or with ESCs that have reverse thrust enabled on a seperate channel Airbrakes need to be enables for your selected model/mixer

parameters.name: VT_B_TRANS_DUR
parameters.longDesc: Time in seconds used for a back transition

parameters.name: VT_B_TRANS_RAMP
parameters.shortDesc: Back transition MC motor ramp up time
parameters.longDesc: This sets the duration during which the MC motors ramp up to the commanded thrust during the back transition stage.

parameters.name: VT_B_TRANS_THR
parameters.shortDesc: Target throttle value for the transition to hover flight. standard vtol: pusher tailsitter, tiltrotor: main throttle
parameters.longDesc: Note for standard vtol: For ESCs and mixers that support reverse thrust on low PWM values set this to a negative value to apply active breaking For ESCs that support thrust reversal with a control channel please set VT_B_REV_OUT and set this to a positive value to apply active breaking

parameters.name: VT_DWN_PITCH_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum allowed angle the vehicle is allowed to pitch down to generate forward force when fixed-wing forward actuation is active (seeVT_FW_TRHUST_EN). If demanded down pitch exceeds this limmit, the fixed-wing forward actuators are used instead

parameters.name: VT_ELEV_MC_LOCK
parameters.longDesc: If set to 1 the elevons are locked in multicopter mode

parameters.name: VT_FWD_THRUST_EN
parameters.shortDesc: Enable/disable usage of fixed-wing actuators in hover to generate forward force (instead of pitching down). This technique can be used to avoid the plane having to pitch down in order to move forward. This prevents large, negative lift values being created when facing strong winds. Fixed-wing forward actuators refers to puller/pusher (standard VTOL), or forward-tilt (tiltrotor VTOL). Only active if demaded down pitch is above VT_DWN_PITCH_MAX, and uses VT_FWD_THRUST_SC to get from demanded down pitch to fixed-wing actuation

values.description: Disable FW forward actuation in hover.
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes (except LANDING).
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes if above MPC_LAND_ALT1.
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes if above MPC_LAND_ALT2.
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes.

parameters.name: VT_FWD_THRUST_SC
parameters.shortDesc: Fixed-wing actuator thrust scale for hover forward flight
parameters.longDesc: Scale applied to the demanded down-pitch to get the fixed-wing forward actuation in hover mode. Only active if demaded down pitch is above VT_DWN_PITCH_MAX. Enabled via VT_FWD_THRUST_EN.

parameters.name: VT_FW_ALT_ERR
parameters.longDesc: Maximum negative altitude error for fixed wing flight. If the altitude drops below this value below the altitude setpoint the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL.

parameters.name: VT_FW_DIFTHR_EN
parameters.longDesc: Set to 1 to enable differential thrust in fixed-wing flight.

parameters.name: VT_FW_DIFTHR_SC
parameters.longDesc: This factor specifies how the yaw input gets mapped to differential thrust in forwards flight.

parameters.name: VT_FW_MIN_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Minimum altitude for fixed wing flight, when in fixed wing the altitude drops below this altitude the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL

parameters.name: VT_FW_MOT_OFFID
parameters.shortDesc: The channel number of motors that must be turned off in fixed wing mode

parameters.name: VT_FW_PERM_STAB
parameters.longDesc: If set to one this parameter will cause permanent attitude stabilization in fw mode. This parameter has been introduced for pure convenience sake.

parameters.name: VT_FW_QC_P
parameters.longDesc: Maximum pitch angle before QuadChute engages Above this the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL

parameters.name: VT_FW_QC_R
parameters.longDesc: Maximum roll angle before QuadChute engages Above this the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL

parameters.name: VT_F_TRANS_DUR
parameters.longDesc: Time in seconds used for a transition

parameters.name: VT_F_TRANS_THR
parameters.shortDesc: Target throttle value for the transition to fixed wing flight. standard vtol: pusher tailsitter, tiltrotor: main throttle

parameters.name: VT_F_TR_OL_TM
parameters.shortDesc: Airspeed less front transition time (open loop)
parameters.longDesc: The duration of the front transition when there is no airspeed feedback available.

parameters.name: VT_IDLE_PWM_MC
parameters.shortDesc: Idle speed of VTOL when in multicopter mode

parameters.name: VT_MC_ON_FMU
parameters.shortDesc: Enable the usage of AUX outputs for hover motors
parameters.longDesc: Set this parameter to true if the vehicle's hover motors are connected to the FMU (AUX) port. Not required for boards that only have a FMU, and no IO. Only applies for standard VTOL and tiltrotor.

parameters.name: VT_MOT_ID
parameters.shortDesc: The channel number of motors which provide lift during hover

parameters.name: VT_PSHER_RMP_DT
parameters.shortDesc: Defines the time window during which the pusher throttle will be ramped up linearly to VT_F_TRANS_THR during a transition to fixed wing mode. Zero or negative values will produce an instant throttle rise to VT_F_TRANS_THR

parameters.name: VT_TILT_FW
parameters.shortDesc: Position of tilt servo in fw mode

parameters.name: VT_TILT_MC
parameters.shortDesc: Position of tilt servo in mc mode

parameters.name: VT_TILT_SPINUP
parameters.shortDesc: Tilt actuator control value commanded when disarmed and during the first second after arming
parameters.longDesc: This specific tilt during spin-up is necessary for some systems whose motors otherwise don't spin-up freely.

parameters.name: VT_TILT_TRANS
parameters.shortDesc: Position of tilt servo in transition mode

parameters.name: VT_TRANS_MIN_TM
parameters.longDesc: Minimum time in seconds for front transition.

parameters.name: VT_TRANS_P2_DUR
parameters.longDesc: Time in seconds it should take for the rotors to rotate forward completely from the point when the plane has picked up enough airspeed and is ready to go into fixed wind mode.

parameters.name: VT_TRANS_TIMEOUT
parameters.longDesc: Time in seconds after which transition will be cancelled. Disabled if set to 0.

parameters.name: WV_GAIN
parameters.longDesc: The desired gain to convert roll sp into yaw rate sp.

parameters.name: WV_ROLL_MIN
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum roll angle setpoint for weathervane controller to demand a yaw-rate

parameters.name: WV_YRATE_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum yawrate the weathervane controller is allowed to demand

parameters.name: ctl_dir
parameters.longDesc: Motor spin direction as detected during initial enumeration. Use 0 or 1 to reverse direction.

parameters.name: ctl_gain
parameters.longDesc: Speed (RPM) controller gain. Determines controller             aggressiveness; units are amp-seconds per radian. Systems with             higher rotational inertia (large props) will need gain increased;             systems with low rotational inertia (small props) may need gain             decreased. Higher values result in faster response, but may result             in oscillation and excessive overshoot. Lower values result in a             slower, smoother response.

parameters.name: ctl_hz_idle
parameters.longDesc: Idle speed (e Hz)

parameters.name: ctl_start_rate
parameters.longDesc: Spin-up rate (e Hz/s)

parameters.name: esc_index
parameters.shortDesc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.
parameters.longDesc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.

parameters.name: gnss.dyn_model
parameters.longDesc: Dynamic model used in the GNSS positioning engine. 0 –         Automotive, 1 – Sea, 2 – Airborne.

parameters.name: gnss.old_fix_msg
parameters.longDesc: Broadcast the old (deprecated) GNSS fix message         uavcan.equipment.gnss.Fix alongside the new alternative         uavcan.equipment.gnss.Fix2. It is recommended to         disable this feature to reduce the CAN bus traffic.

parameters.name: gnss.warn_dimens
parameters.longDesc: Set the device health to Warning if the dimensionality of               the GNSS solution is less than this value. 3 for the full (3D)               solution, 2 for planar (2D) solution, 1 for time-only solution,               0 disables the feature.

parameters.name: gnss.warn_sats
parameters.longDesc: Set the device health to Warning if the number of satellites         used in the GNSS solution is below this threshold. Zero         disables the feature

parameters.name: id_ext_status
parameters.longDesc: Extended status ID

parameters.name: int_ext_status
parameters.longDesc: Extended status interval (µs)

parameters.name: int_status
parameters.longDesc: ESC status interval (µs)

parameters.name: mot_i_max
parameters.longDesc: Motor current limit in amps. This determines the maximum             current controller setpoint, as well as the maximum allowable             current setpoint slew rate. This value should generally be set to             the continuous current rating listed in the motor’s specification             sheet, or set equal to the motor’s specified continuous power             divided by the motor voltage limit.

parameters.name: mot_kv
parameters.shortDesc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt
parameters.longDesc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt. This can be taken from the motor’s             specification sheet; accuracy will help control performance but             some deviation from the specified value is acceptable.

parameters.name: mot_ls
parameters.shortDesc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries.
parameters.longDesc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries. This is measured on start-up.

parameters.name: mot_num_poles
parameters.longDesc: Number of motor poles. Used to convert mechanical speeds to             electrical speeds. This number should be taken from the motor’s             specification sheet.

parameters.name: mot_rs
parameters.shortDesc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms
parameters.longDesc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms. This is measured on start-up. When             tuning a new motor, check that this value is approximately equal             to the value shown in the motor’s specification sheet.

parameters.name: mot_v_accel
parameters.longDesc: Acceleration limit (V)

parameters.name: mot_v_max
parameters.longDesc: Motor voltage limit in volts. The current controller’s             commanded voltage will never exceed this value. Note that this may             safely be above the nominal voltage of the motor; to determine the             actual motor voltage limit, divide the motor’s rated power by the             motor current limit.

parameters.name: uavcan.pubp-pres
parameters.longDesc: Set the device health to Warning if the number of satellites         used in the GNSS solution is below this threshold. Zero         disables the feature
